value.title: Implement resiliency in a cloud-native ASP.NET Core microservice
value.excerpt: This module guides you through implementing resiliency in an ASP.NET Core microservices app in Azure Kubernetes Service.

value.excerpt: Saurya Das joins Scott Hanselman to show how multiple node pools for Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) enable you to use different virtual machine sizes in a node pool supporting a variety of workloads in a single AKS cluster. For example, an e-commerce website can have a node pool for a billing service

Mark deploys an image processing container in three ways: as a standalone ACI container, as part of a Logic Apps workflow, and as the backend

Use AKS Diagnostics to identify problems and get actionable recommendations on how to resolve AKS cluster issues. Run AKS Periscope in VS Code to easily collect and export node
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/E-XqYb88hUY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Build serverless, full stack applications in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to create, build, and deploy modern full stack applications in Azure by using the language of your choice (Python, Node.js, or .NET) and with a Vue.js frontend. Topics covered include modern database capabilities, CI/CD and DevOps, backend API development, REST, and more. Using a real-world scenario of trying to catch the bus, you will learn how to build a solution that uses Azure SQL Database, Azure Functions, Azure Static Web Apps, Logic Apps, Visual Studio Code, and GitHub Actions.

topItems.title: Architect modern applications using Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Break down a scenario for an application and build a multi-service solution based on the microservices approach. Learn how to use modern database capabilities to build a foundation for applications.

topItems.title: Deploy serverless APIs with Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: In the language of your choice (Node.js, Python, or .NET), learn how to deploy an Azure Function that adds real-time data to an Azure SQL Database and triggers an Azure Logic App for notifications, all with GitHub Actions for CI/CD.

topItems.title: Architect full-stack applications and automate deployments with GitHub
topItems.excerpt: In the language of your choice (Node.js, Python, or .NET), deploy an end-to-end solution to solve the real-world scenario of catching the bus. You'll learn how to architect a solution that uses Azure SQL Database, Azure Functions, Azure Static Web Apps, Logic Apps, Visual Studio Code, and GitHub Actions.

value.title: Provision and manage Azure Cognitive Services
value.excerpt: Learn about Cognitive Services and the important role they play in developing AI infused applications.  This learning path will introduce you to creating, managing, and deploying Cognitive Services in the Azure portal or through containers.

topItems.title: Create and manage Cognitive Services
topItems.excerpt: Azure Cognitive Services enable developers to easily add cognitive features into their applications. Learn how to configure and manage these services for your AI application needs.

topItems.title: Investigate container for use with Cognitive Services
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Container support in Cognitive Services allowing the use of APIs available in Azure and enable flexibility in where to deploy and host the services with Docker containers.

topItems.title: Secure Cognitive Services
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to secure Cognitive Services to prevent data loss and privacy violations for user data that may be a part of the solution.

value.title: Access Metrics from your Azure Blob Storage Containers Programmatically
value.excerpt: Discover how to use Azure Monitor to gather performance metrics and then configure and access those metrics from .NET application code.

value.title: Application scalability on AKS with HorizontalPodAutoscalers
value.excerpt: Explore how to scale your deployed applications with HorizontalPodAutoscalers in AKS.

value.title: Cluster autoscaling with AKS
value.excerpt: Learn how to scale your AKS cluster automatically using the cluster autoscaler

value.title: Deploy and manage a stateful application using CosmosDB and Azure Kubernetes Service
value.excerpt: Create and manage a stateful application with an external storage using CosmosDB and Azure Kubernetes Service

value.title: Manage Application Configuration and Secrets in Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
value.excerpt: Learn how to securely store application secrets and configurations using native Kubernetes resources in Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).

value.title: Azure Kubernetes Service Workshop
value.excerpt: In this workshop, you'll go through tasks to deploy a multicontainer application to Kubernetes on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).

value.title: Application and package management using Helm
value.excerpt: Helm is an application package manager for Kubernetes that you use to standardize and simplify the deployment of cloud-native applications on Kubernetes. Here you'll see how to install third-party packages called Helm charts and how to create and install Helm charts for the workloads your teams develop.

value.title: Externalize the configuration of an ASP.NET app by using an Azure key vault
value.excerpt: Learn how to use ConfigurationBuilder to dynamically configure an ASP.NET web app to retrieve secrets from an Azure key vault.

value.title: Implement logging in a .NET Framework ASP.NET web application
value.excerpt: Learn how to implement logging in an ASP.NET web application so you can store log data in Azure Blob storage and incorporate log information into Azure Application Insights performance data.

value.title: Improve session scalability in a .NET Framework ASP.NET web application by using Azure Cache for Redis
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Cache for Redis to store session data and improve the scalability of web applications.

value.title: Architect full-stack applications and automate deployments with GitHub
value.excerpt: In the language of your choice (Node.js, Python, or .NET), deploy an end-to-end solution to solve the real-world scenario of catching the bus. You'll learn how to architect a solution that uses Azure SQL Database, Azure Functions, Azure Static Web Apps, Logic Apps, Visual Studio Code, and GitHub Actions.

value.title: Secure your apps by using the sidecar configuration in Azure Container Instances
value.excerpt: Roll out Azure Container Instances into an Azure Virtual Network. You will evolve a basic container group into a more sophisticated configuration leveraging sidecar and initialization containers, as well as use private link to access other Azure PaaS resources.

value.title: Build and store container images with Azure Container Registry
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Docker to build, store, and manage private container images with the Azure Container Registry.

value.title: Implement Azure App Service on Kubernetes with Arc
value.excerpt: Azure App Service on Kubernetes with Azure Arc enables implementation of Azure application-platform services on customer-managed, Arc-onboarded Kubernetes clusters. Azure App Service is one you can implement.
